questions.question: Which of the following metrics assesses how easy it is to modify a software system?
The term 'software crisis' refers to:
Which of the following describes the degree to which the software performs its intended functions?
In object-oriented design, what is a blueprint for creating objects that defines its properties and behaviors?
Which process ensures that the final product meets both functional and non-functional requirements?
What is the primary goal of the V-Model (Verification and Validation Model)?

options.A: To emphasize documentation over working software
options.B: To improve communication among development teams
options.C: To ensure each development phase has a corresponding testing phase
options.D: To encourage frequent changes to requirements

questions.question: Which software metric measures the complexity of a program's control flow?
What is the main objective of 'code refactoring' in software development?

options.A: Adding new features to the software
options.C: Optimizing the code's structure and design without changing its behavior
options.D: Conducting security testing on the code

questions.question: In which phase of the software development life cycle are acceptance criteria typically defined?
Which type of software testing aims to find defects that occur when software components interact?
What is the primary purpose of a 'traceability matrix' in requirements engineering?

options.A: To track changes made during the coding phase
options.B: To visualize the architecture of the software
options.C: To map requirements to design elements and test cases

questions.question: Which type of software requirement specifies what the system should not do?
What is the main difference between 'verification' and 'validation' in software testing?

options.A: Verification ensures that the software meets user requirements, while validation ensures that it meets technical specifications.
options.B: Verification focuses on individual modules, while validation assesses the overall system.
options.C: Verification is performed by developers, while validation is performed by independent testers.
options.D: Verification involves testing the software's functionality, while validation involves reviewing the code.

questions.question: Which software development model places a strong emphasis on risk assessment and mitigation?
What is the main goal of a 'walkthrough' in the context of requirements engineering?

options.A: To find defects in the code
options.B: To review and discuss the requirements with stakeholders

questions.question: Which type of testing aims to assess the software's performance under realistic conditions?
What does the term 'COCOMO' refer to in software engineering?

options.B: A software metric for code quality

questions.question: Which stage of the software development process involves translating system requirements into a programming language?
What is the purpose of a 'defect tracking system' in software development?

options.A: To track the time spent on coding
options.D: To log and manage software defects

questions.question: Which type of coupling indicates a strong interdependence between software modules?
